items.sentence: If you had a million dollars, what would you do?
Is something going on that I need to know about?
Tom noticed Mary wasn\'t wearing a wedding ring.
I\'m sick of eating at the same place every day.
Tom put on a bullet-proof vest, just to be safe.
Tom put together a neighborhood basketball team.
I\'ll be back in time for my mother\'s birthday.
You like to talk about architecture, don\'t you?
A customs official asked me to open my suitcase.
I can\'t fit that in my suitcase. It\'s too big.
Tom saved a bird which had fallen from its nest.
The baby was sound asleep in her mother\'s arms.
It is a four-hour drive from New York to Boston.
It looks like rain. We should close the windows.
Tom\'s neighborhood was flooded after the storm.
Tom gets angry when he doesn\'t get his own way.
I think it\'s time for me to ask for his advice.
I think we\'ve bought almost everything we need.
I want you to know what\'s true and what\'s not.
What makes you think Tom won\'t want to do that?
The police car was driving at fairly high speed.
You can\'t imagine how difficult it was for Tom.
Do you want to know where you made your mistake?
I\'ve been thinking about going to Boston again.
I\'ve been trying to tell Tom how I really feel.
I\'ve found this website to be extremely useful.
There\'s something about Tom that I don\'t like.
You never really wanted to divorce Tom, did you?
You never seemed to really want to study French.
You ought to tell Tom to do that more carefully.
You promised me that you would take care of Tom.
You promised that you would be there last night.
You said you had something that belonged to Tom.
Tom thought his eyes were playing tricks on him.
Tom said he could swim at least as well as Mary.
You\'re too young to be doing that, aren\'t you?
You\'re too young to join the army, aren\'t you?
I think we should consider doing something else.
I don\'t think we\'d have any chance of winning.
I can\'t believe you\'re considering doing that.
I think Tom doesn\'t really like Mary very much.
Tom, Mary and John are sitting around the table.
I\'d just like to talk with Tom before we leave.
I\'d like everybody except Tom to leave, please.
I\'d like to believe that Tom told us the truth.
I\'d like to make a reservation for next Monday.
I didn\'t think Tom was really paying attention.
I don\'t have enough money to buy a new bicycle.
I don\'t know whether to go to the party or not.
Please reply as soon as you\'ve read this email.
